query: What ECOG performance status must participants have for trial NCT06556563?
answers: Have an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status of 0 to 1 assessed within 7 days before randomization.

query: What measurable disease requirement does NCT02586857 enforce?
answers: Measurable disease (bidimensional) as defined by the RANO criteria, with a minimum measurement of 1 cm in longest diameter on MRI performed within 21 days of first dose of acalabrutinib; MRI must have been obtained ≥4 weeks after any salvage surgery after first or second relapse.

query: Which anticoagulant therapies exclude someone from NCT06051214?
answers: Patient on low molecular weight heparins, standard unfractionated heparins and anti-vitamin K2

query: How many biopsy samples must be obtainable during surgery in NCT05386043?
answers: Subject has sufficient tissue so that the study team is able to acquire at least 2 biopsy samples during resection.

query: Name the STAT3-targeting drug administered in NCT05879250.
answers: STAT3 Inhibitor WP1066

query: Which BRAF alterations qualify participants for MATCH subprotocol Z1L (NCT06400225)?
answers: Patients must have a BRAF non-V600 mutation or BRAF fusion, or another BRAF aberration, as determined via the MATCH Master Protocol

query: What tissue availability is required before enrolling in NCT03529448?
answers: Patients must have at least 15 slides without staining or a tissue block (frozen or paraffin-embedded) available from a previous biopsy or surgery (tumour sample previously archived).

query: Which condition does trial NCT05118776 focus on?
answers: Recurrent Glioblastoma

query: In trial NCT06989086, who can enroll as caregivers?
answers: Caregivers: nonprofessional caregiver to a patient with a primary malignant brain tumor (grade II-IV)
nonprofessional caregiver to a patient with a primary malignant brain tumor (grade II-IV)

query: What biomarker testing is required in NCT04765514 before randomization?
answers: MGMT promoter methylation status must be tested for all patients.

query: What outcome measure tracks the MRI sequence program in NCT06041555?
answers: Hypoxia mapping

query: Which drug is paired with radiodynamic therapy in NCT05590689?
answers: DRUG: Gliolan
Gliolan

query: What hypofractionated approach is being tested against conventional radiotherapy in NCT06740955?
answers: RADIATION: hypofractionated postoperative radiotherapy

query: For NCT03451799, how long is safety of the ketogenic diet monitored?
answers: Four Months
Four months

query: What tumor grades must be documented for eligibility in NCT06275919?
answers: Histological diagnosis of grade 2 or grade 3 meningioma according to the WHO 2021 classification

query: Which radiation technique is delivered upfront in NCT03251027?
answers: RADIATION: Intensity-Modulated Radiation Therapy

query: What confirmation is required before administering the DRI γδ T cell injection in NCT04165941?
answers: Must have histologically or cytologically confirmed glioblastoma multiforme prior to administration of the DRI γδ T cell injection.

query: Which PET tracer is collected as part of the imaging regimen in NCT06113705?
answers: DIAGNOSTIC_TEST: 18F-GE-180 PET
18F-GE-180 PET

query: What biomarker must patients carry to join NCT06308822?
answers: Patients must have FGFR Amplification as determined via the MATCH Master Protocol.

query: Which diagnosis leads to exclusion from NCT04306432?
answers: Glioblastoma

query: What is the official title of NCT04440358?
answers: Assessment of Safety and Feasibility of Exablate Blood-Brain Barrier Disruption (BBBD) With Microbubbles for the Treatment of Recurrent Glioblastoma (rGBM) in Subjects Undergoing Carboplatin Monotherapy
